Episode: 1
Location: Aboard Mephistopheles's Deck
It hasn't been so long since this bus... I mean, busboat was hounded by the sirens and the flashing green lights.
The Sinners were sitting uncomfortably, trying to get some shut-eye in the ship cabins(formerly known as the bus cabins). The thought of returning to their rooms didn't even seem to occur to them.
Faust ......
After gazing out the window for a while, Faust came to her feet and approached the helm(formerly known as the wheel).
Vergilius Ms. Faust.
Faust Yes. We have received a signal.
Dante <Faust?>
Yi Sang Hurk... Haah... The long-awaited signal has arrived, then...?
Don Quixote Oooh! Then shall our adventure in the Great Lake finally commence?!
Sinclair What signal? I don't hear or see anything... Not even an alarm.
Faust A smoke signal outside our visual range has been picked up by Mephistopheles.
Gregor A smoke signal... the beacons are lit, then. I guess that's what we've been sitting on our butts for.
Charon Sailing is a go. Splish splash.
Faust Soon... we will be moving away from the coastal area and draw closer to what one could call the Great Lake approach.
Faust Activating automatic navigation system now.
Don Quixote How, how! Thou meanest to say that what we have experienced so far... was not the Great Lake?
Faust By strict definition... Yes, it was. We have been inside the Great Lake's borders for a while. Yet I make the distinction based on the information available to you, as our path has so far lacked any real threats.
Don Quixote No real... threats, thou sayeth. After all that...
Don Quixote Lo! Yi Sang there has hitherto been burying his face in that very bucket, I shall have thee know...!
Yi Sang I... mind me not, plea— hurk...

Faust Walpurgis Night.
Faust And... not many of those 'threats' could be attributed to the dangers of the Great Lake.
Meursault False Cause Fallacy.
Don Quixote ... Quite the rush of daunting ideas thou hast thrown in mine direction. I shall henceforth continue to slumber, then...
Outis NO! We have just entered a hostile environment. We must rouse ourselves from sleep and ready ourselves for what dangers there may be.

Outis All hands, to defensive stations!
Outis suddenly leaped to her feet and began barking orders at the Sinners.
Gregor Guh?!
Heathcliff ... What in the bloody...
Gregor ... Augh, my heart dropped for a sec there.

She continued before I even had the chance to reply.
Outis Atten-tion! Sailing, that is to say, the act of traveling across bodies of water...
After an indeterminate amount of time...
Outis ... And that concludes the fundamentals of sailing! Have you been taking your notes, men?
Charon Snore, snore.
Don Quixote Oho, marvelous! Quite a considerable amount of new knowledge I have acquired! 'Tis akin to an adventure, is it not?!
Don Quixote 'Twas one of mine humble eight-hundred-and-sixty-three old dreams to sail the Great Lake as an adventurer, like a challenger of storms, a queller of rogue waves!

Sinclair Outis, Ma'am? I have a q-question!
Outis Yes, you are recognized.

Outis ... Um.

Outis ......
Outis ... Hm...
Sinclair Uh, Outis...?
Outis Hmph. I've been seeing more and more of these as of late. These so-called 'bleeding-edge' technologies are hollow inventions that have nothing to show for it aside from their pretty exteriors.
Outis A blind pursuit of convenience breeds increased risk. There's nothing but ruin at the end of the road paved with overreliance on these bleeding-edge technologies!
Outis Fervor fueled in the furnace of bolts and engine oil, the ship's blood and sweat...
Outis A combined force of the commanding officer's decisive leadership and their subordinates' firm loyalty.

Outis I, Outis... Shall prove it to the world.

Charon That's what you get for abandoning your bus driver.
Dante <Wait, wait. So we're just stuck here?>
Faust Of course not. While Mephistopheles' engine may be inoperable as it has melded with the automatic navigation system, the ship itself can still move.
Faust We still have a manually activated backup power system on standby.
